definitions.definition: A liquid (often thickened) condiment or accompaniment to food.
Tomato sauce (similar to US tomato ketchup), as in:

definitions.example: Maybe you should lay off the sauce.

definitions.definition: A soft crayon for use in stump drawing or in shading with the stump.
Any garden vegetables eaten with meat.
To add sauce to; to season.
To cause to relish anything, as if with a sauce; to tickle or gratify, as the palate; to please; to stimulate.
To make poignant; to give zest, flavour or interest to; to set off; to vary and render attractive.
To treat with bitter, pert, or tart language; to be impudent or saucy to.
The person, place or thing from which something (information, goods, etc.) comes or is acquired.
definitions.example: The accused refused to reveal the source of the illegal drugs she was selling.

definitions.definition: Spring; fountainhead; wellhead; any collection of water on or under the surface of the ground in which a stream originates.
definitions.example: The main sources of the Euphrates River are the Karasu and Murat Rivers.

definitions.definition: The name of one terminal of a field effect transistor (FET).
